column2: OKLAHOMA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 2. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column6: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 3. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 4. Alcohol:
column6: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column8: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 5. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column6: single broken white

column2: 6. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column6: No.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: Multiple turns ahead

column2: 8. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column6: .02% or higher.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 10. Alcohol:
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 11. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.
column8: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: No trucks allowed

column2: 13. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 14. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: rideplaning.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 16. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 17. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 18. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: blue rectangles.

column2: 19. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 20. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column6: The other answers are both correct.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 21. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To halt the traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 22. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 23. Motorcycles:
column4: are easier to see than cars.
column6: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.

column2: 24. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column10: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 25. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: when it's been raining all day.
column6: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column8: during the first half hour of rain.
